did.unittitle: Capital District Senior Issues Forum Records
did.abstract: This collection contains the day-to-day work of the Capital District Senior Issues Forum from its inception in early 1998.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection includes administrative materials, newsletters, event programs, correspondence, award materials, and legislative materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Capital District Senior Issues Forum began in 1998 as a pilot program focused on senior housing at Albany's Westminster Presbyterian Church. The Forum moved its headquarters to Catholic Charities in 1999-2000 and established its formal governance structure, which included an all-volunteer member Steering Committee and an Advisory Committee. The voluntary initiative organization is composed of faith communities, organizations, and individuals.

Forum members come together to identify and address issues of concern for older seniors in the Capital District of New York, generate support within the faith communities, educate the Capital District about senior needs, and recognize the accomplishments of older seniors.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Kitt Jackson donated all materials in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in January 2020.
